text:
Fishermen of Pudukottai and Nagapattinam district resorted to indefinite strike demanding the immediate release of the fishermen arrested by Sri Lankan navy personnel.

In Pudukottai district, 700 mechanised boats were seen anchored at Jagapattinam and Kottaipattinam. In Nagapattinam district, 1,000 mechanised boats were anchored at the shores.

Mohandas, a coordinator of the Nagapattinam fishermen panchayatdars, said the strike would continue till a final solution was arrived at. Apart from mechanised boat owners, over 6,000 country boats too did not venture into the sea today. He said the Centre should initiate action for holding talks with the Lankan government for the release of the fishermen.

Further, a permanent solution should be arrived at for checking the arrest of the Tamil Nadu fishermen.

Further, the boats and nets seized by the Sri Lankan fishermen should be returned.
title: Fishermen resort to indefinite strike
